lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* Interprets user input, executes Command and returns Duke's response.
* @param input The input of the user.
return "You have not entered a command!";
* @return true if Duke is still running, false if Duke is no longer running.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Class representing an Add command in Duke.
* @param toAdd The task to be added to the list of tasks.
* Adds new task to existing list of tasks.
* Updates the task storage of new task.
* Prompts the user that the task has been added and show the total number of tasks.
* @param messageFormatter Formats Duke's response into a String.
* @param storage Updates tasks.txt of the new task.
* @return Duke's response after adding task to the list.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage) {
* @param messageFormatter Formats Duke's response into a String.
* @param storage Updates the tasks.txt file after executing commands modifying TaskList/tasks.
* @return Duke's response after executing the command.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage);
* Returns whether the user has requested to exit the application.
* @return false for all commands except the ExitCommand, which overrides this method.
* @param indexToDelete The index of the task to be deleted.
* Removes task from list of tasks.
* Prompts the user that the task has been removed and shows the total number of tasks.
* @param messageFormatter Formats Duke's response into a String.
* @param storage Updates tasks.txt of the removed task.
* @return Duke's response after deleting task from the list.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage) {

* Prompts the user that the task has been marked done.

* @param storage Updates tasks.txt of the completed task.
* @return Duke's response after setting task as done.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage) {
* @param messageFormatter Formats Duke's response into a String.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage) {

public String execute(TaskList tasks, MessageFormatter messageFormatter, TaskStorage storage) {

public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {

DialogBox.getUserDialog("Hello, my name is Duke. How can I help you?",
* Sets a delay before exiting from the application.
* A 1.5 second delay is set to allow the user to view the farewell message by Duke.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Class representing a Deadline, a sub-class of Task.
* @param description A brief description of the Deadline.
* @param deadline Date and Time of the Deadline.
* @param description A brief description of the deadline.
* @param isDone "0" if task is not done. "1" if task is done.
public Deadline(String description, String isDone, LocalDateTime deadline) {
* Returns the Date and Time of the Deadline.
* @return A String representing the deadline in the following format: "YYYY-MM-DD HHmm".
* Returns a String representation of the Deadline to be displayed to the user.
* Shows the description, date and time of the Deadline, as well as whether it is done.
* Class representing an Event, a sub-class of Task.
* @param description A brief description of the Event.
* @param eventTime Date and Time of the Event.
* @param description A brief description of the Event.
* @param isDone "0" if the task is not done. "1" if the task is done.
* @param eventTime Date and Time of the Event.
public Event(String description, String isDone, LocalDateTime eventTime) {
* Returns the Date and Time of the Event.
* @return A String representing the event date and time in the following format: "YYYY-MM-DD HHmm".
* Returns a String representation of the Event to be displayed to the user.
* Shows the description, date and time of the Event, as well as whether it is done.
* @param description A brief description of the task.
* @param isDone "0" if the task is done. "1" if the task is not done.
* Displays whether a task is done.
* @return A cross symbol if task is not done, a tick symbol if task is done.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the status of the task, whether it is done or not.
* @return True if the task is done, false if task is not done.
* Returns the status and the description of the task.
* @return A tick/cross symbol and the description of the task.
* Class representing a ToDo task, a sub-class of Task.
* @param description A brief description of the ToDo task.
* @param description A brief description of the ToDo task.
* @param isDone "0" if the task is not done. "1" if the task is done.
* Returns a String representation of the ToDo task to be displayed to the user.
* Shows the description of the task, as well as whether it is done.
* @return A String representing the ToDo task.
* Class containing methods that formats Duke's messages to the user.
* Formats Duke's message to the user after adding a task.
* @param taskAdded The task added by Duke.
* @return A String that lets the user know which task was added, as well as the
*          current size of the list of tasks.
public String formatAddCmdMsg(Task taskAdded, TaskList tasks) {
return ("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + taskAdded +
tasks.getSize() + (tasks.getSize() == 1 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in your list");
* Formats Duke's message to the user after removing a task.

*          current size of the list of tasks.
public String formatRemoveCmdMsg(Task taskRemoved, TaskList tasks) {
tasks.getSize() + (tasks.getSize() == 1 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in your list");
* Formats Duke's message to the user after setting a task as completed.
* @param taskDone The task that was set as completed.

return ("Nice! I have marked this task as done:\n" + taskDone);
* Formats Duke's message to the user after searching for tasks that matches

* @return A String that displays all the tasks that matches the keyword provided.
return "There are no tasks with such keyword!";
String msg = "I have found tasks with the given keyword:\n";

return "There are no tasks to display!";

throw new DukeArgumentException("You have not entered a task description!");

private static void checkDateTime(String[] details) throws DukeDateTimeException {
throw new DukeDateTimeException("You have not entered a date and time!");
* Checks whether the user has entered a valid task index.

private static int checkNumericalArgument(String[] split, TaskList tasks) throws DukeArgumentException {

throw new DukeArgumentException("Please enter a numerical value for the task index!");

throw new DukeArgumentException("Please enter a valid task index!");
